- Is the library actively maintained?

  The last commit in the library was almost a year ago but the owner of
  the library is active on github. The code base itself is not large 1k
  LOC and all the promised features are implemented.

- Is the library good code?

  Yes, the code looks good and tested.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?

  Yes, package is licensed as 3-clause BSD.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  No but it is available on PyPI.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  I could not find any other package in the requirements that allows
  definition of models, and is able to serialize them to python natives
  primitives and JSON.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  We would like to use this library in Dragonflow to implement model
  classes with JSON as their backend.

  See:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/410298/
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/414984/

Change-Id: I7a8035fdf75ac348f09c4445b7938e315a01f1bf
'}]
commit_message:
Add jsonmodels requirement

- Is the library actively maintained?

  The last commit in the library was almost a year ago but the owner of
  the library is active on github. The code base itself is not large 1k
  LOC and all the promised features are implemented.

- Is the library good code?

  Yes, the code looks good and tested.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?

  Yes, package is licensed as 3-clause BSD.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  No but it is available on PyPI.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  I could not find any other package in the requirements that allows
  definition of models, and is able to serialize them to python natives
  primitives and JSON.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  We would like to use this library in Dragonflow to implement model
  classes with JSON as their backend.

  See:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/410298/
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/414984/

Change-Id: I7a8035fdf75ac348f09c4445b7938e315a01f1bf

commit_message:
Update docstring of _schema_validation_helper

During review of this new helper method there were some comments
about clarifying the docstring for usage. This patch adds the
clarification.

Change-Id: I15177a55768423ae57dce244070de026c34c9418
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/18/417118/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If the version range matches the request, we validate the schema against the target and a failure will result in a ValidationError being raised. :returns: A boolean. `True` if and only if the version range matches the request AND the schema is successfully validated. `False` if the version range does not match the request and no validation is performed.
deleted_lines: :returns: A boolean. `True` if the JSON-Schema matches the request version otherwise `False`.

commit_message:
After network checker is finished nodes must stay in discovery state

Nodes should not be moved to error or ready states, when network
checke process is finished.

Closes-bug: #1653292
Change-Id: I323efcea895f18206f8d8404aa3d870e3b1e7a51

Add parameters to exclude network roles for network verification

Also rename network checker parameters to `connectivity_checker`.

commit_message:
Implementation Neutron SR-IOV

This change adds the new attribute
``sriov_host_interface`` in order to map ml2 network
names to physical SR-IOV capable network interfaces.

Co-Authored-By: James Denton <james.denton@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: Ia62725e2369f75000157e0ab2c3f858e61fef10d
Closes-Bug: #1653283

Change-Id: I3fbe4acbdf0281c91801ff7d09de6e9043915939

commit_message:
Add Constraints support and missing bindep.txt dependencies

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove os-brick.

Finally, it also adds libxml2 and libxslt to bindep.txt for use when
building cryptography.

Change-Id: I3fbe4acbdf0281c91801ff7d09de6e9043915939

commit_message:
Add more structure and hints about the process

The docs are clear about our overall process as a group, but these are
specific guides for those wanting to submit proposals.

Change-Id: I485f80e96b8c3b68ec2c2bab6f941471bfe972e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/arch-wg refs/changes/26/411526/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: These are mostly free-form documents, that should answer a few base questions: * What specifically do you think is in need of architectural design work in OpenStack? * What background supports your claim that there's need to spend resources analyzing, designing, and changing OpenStack in this way? * Do you have ideas for what the Architecture Working Group would do with this proposal? This would generally be, but is not limited to, some of the following things: * Produce an accurate analysis on the current state of [topic]. * Produce a cross-project spec and/or community goal for OpenStack to work to support findings. * Find and integrate existing solutions from outside OpenStack via drivers/plugins/etc. As long as the proposal is on-topic for OpenStack, we will merge it and begin work to either accept it and gather support for working on it, improve the proposal, or reject it. The ultimate goal is to move the proposal out of here into backlog or active. The proposal should be ammended with next-steps before or while it is moved to backlog or active. Rejected proposals will be moved to rejected.

commit_message:
add blueprint for collectd datasource

Change-Id: I402a808af9b15b190a3e6654cab45d434a475dc2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage-specs refs/changes/45/415245/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================== Collectd Data Source ==================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/vitrage/+spec/collectd-datasource This blueprint describes the datasource that will receive notifications from collectd notification Problem description =================== Vitrage should be able to accept to collectd notification. Proposed change =============== The Collectd datasource will receive notifications in the following format: { 'host': "compute-1", 'plugin': "ovs_events", 'plugin_instance': "br-ex", 'type': "gauge", 'type_instance': "link_status", 'message': "link state of "br-ex" interface has been changed to "WARNING,"", 'severity': "WARNING,", 'time': 1482409029.062524, 'id': "46c7eba7753efb0e6f6a8de24c949c52" } Upon receiving such a notification, the Collectd datasource will create a corresponding alarm in Vitrage. When receiving an ok notification, the alarm will be deleted. In addition, a new evaluator template will be added in order to: - Create deduced alarms on the VMs running on the host - Modify the states of the host and the VMs to ERROR - Call Nova force-down API to mark that the host is down Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: eyal bar ilan Work Items ---------- - Implement the Collectd datasource - Write a template for creating deduced alarms on the VMs and calling Nova mark host down Testing ======= The changes will be tested by unit tests References ========== - https://collectd.org/

commit_message:
Revert "Ignore heartbeats lock fails"

It seems that there are at least two level of ruby-stomp brokenness and
the fact that the mutex in original commit is locked actually means
there is no heartbeat received in time and we need to do something about
this.

This reverts commit 8318d7056556337f17f596edad9d7eed48ec3ca5.

Partial-Bug: #1644618
Change-Id: I565f430d17bcee2c50c0ddc8ecc11f3dc8b420ed
(cherry picked from commit 13b4d0f38e2a3e1c4d0ac0d91a7bce1dc23d7c8a)
(cherry picked from commit 64ab61d3ddb36cf956c6da0fb52a72c8f6f9590e)

commit_message:
Fix wrong column change to Logical_Switch_Port when neutron port update

When neutron router port was updated(e.g. Admin state down up), 'type' column
in Logical_Switch_Port was changed from router to ''. It broke patch-pair in
south DB.

Change-Id: I60ed355983162a5043c488749b871efb8e164ed8
Closes-Bug: #1653120
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/01/415701/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set port_type to None that the type column in Logical_Switch_Port # table will not be updated port_type = None if not ovn_port_info.type: ovn_port_info.type = ''

added_lines:

subject: Fix eventlet monkey_patch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-11 01:46:37.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/cmd/xjob.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/5ae4d994b45a644c37b3c7f2b3ed1e7f1bc2fcf3', 'message': "Fix eventlet monkey_patch

1. What is the problem
After patch 416771 is merged, we change to use registered tricircle
command to start our api and xjob instead of python script, this
introduces a problem that eventlet.monkey_patch is not correctly
executed so xjob fails to handle RPC request.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Directly execute eventlet.monkey_patch in cmd/xjob.py without
checking if it's imported as a module or run by python script.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
No new features

Change-Id: I56d1491b0353f64beeb75d652bbd01cdf932b044
"}]
commit_message:
Fix eventlet monkey_patch

1. What is the problem
After patch 416771 is merged, we change to use registered tricircle
command to start our api and xjob instead of python script, this
introduces a problem that eventlet.monkey_patch is not correctly
executed so xjob fails to handle RPC request.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Directly execute eventlet.monkey_patch in cmd/xjob.py without
checking if it's imported as a module or run by python script.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
No new features

Change-Id: I56d1491b0353f64beeb75d652bbd01cdf932b044
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/39/418639/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: eventlet.monkey_patch()

commit_message:
Add construct lib for data parsing

The python construct lib can be used to facilitate parsing of binary data,
for example network protocols.  It is documented here:
http://construct.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

An example of this library in openstack is in parsing network
switch LLDP data as implemented here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/406496/.
It simplifies the description of the LLDP structures and makes parsing of bit
and byte fields relatively straightforward.

The construct lib is licensed under the MIT license.  It supports Python 2.7
and 3.5.

This lib appears to be actively maintained, the latest release was on
12/31/16 in the git repository
https://github.com/construct/construct/releases.

Change-Id: I5debba09e832a541b6d139856bb601f31da4a7ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/93/416293/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use i18n to translate msg in LOG.xxx()

1.Help messages and output info should support oslo.i18n. So we
should use oslo.i18n in LOG.warning()/LOG.error()/ LOG.info()
/LOG.critical()/LOG.exception().

2.Not all files need to translate msg, tests directory and dev directory
are faced with developers, so they need to nothing.

The more information as follow:
 [1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html
 [2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/usage.html

Co-Authored-By: shizhihui <zhihui.shi@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: Iced712f8833e90f3570497cd033713bdc34c27da

commit_message:
Add designate zone support

Designate supports the zone from v2 api
and this patch adds support for zone resource
plugin.

Change-Id: I92df0c295ae12f7fb2351aaf030bd7c916f49177
implements: blueprint heat-designate-recordset-zone
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/54/415154/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from heat.engine.resources.openstack.designate import zone from heat.engine import stack from heat.engine import template from heat.tests import common from heat.tests import utils sample_template = { 'heat_template_version': '2015-04-30', 'resources': { 'test_resource': { 'type': 'OS::Designate::Zone', 'properties': { 'name': 'test-zone.com', 'description': 'Test zone', 'ttl': 3600, 'email': 'abc@test-zone.com', 'type': 'PRIMARY', 'masters': ['test'] } } } } RESOURCE_TYPE = 'OS::Designate::Zone' class DesignateZoneTest(common.HeatTestCase): def setUp(self): super(DesignateZoneTest, self).setUp() self.ctx = utils.dummy_context() self.stack = stack.Stack( self.ctx, 'test_stack', template.Template(sample_template) ) self.test_resource = self.stack['test_resource'] # Mock client plugin self.test_client_plugin = mock.MagicMock() self.test_resource.client_plugin = mock.MagicMock( return_value=self.test_client_plugin) # Mock client self.test_client = mock.MagicMock() self.test_resource.client = mock.MagicMock( return_value=self.test_client) def _get_mock_resource(self): value = {} value['id'] = '477e8273-60a7-4c41-b683-fdb0bc7cd152' value['serial'] = '1434596972' return value def test_resource_handle_create(self): mock_zone_create = self.test_client.zones.create mock_resource = self._get_mock_resource() mock_zone_create.return_value = mock_resource # validate the properties self.assertEqual( 'test-zone.com', self.test_resource.properties.get(zone.DesignateZone.NAME)) self.assertEqual( 'Test zone', self.test_resource.properties.get( zone.DesignateZone.DESCRIPTION)) self.assertEqual( 3600, self.test_resource.properties.get(zone.DesignateZone.TTL)) self.assertEqual( 'abc@test-zone.com', self.test_resource.properties.get(zone.DesignateZone.EMAIL)) self.assertEqual( 'PRIMARY', self.test_resource.properties.get(zone.DesignateZone.TYPE)) self.assertEqual( ['test'], self.test_resource.properties.get(zone.DesignateZone.MASTERS)) self.test_resource.data_set = mock.Mock() self.test_resource.handle_create() args = dict( name='test-zone.com', description='Test zone', ttl=3600, email='abc@test-zone.com', type_='PRIMARY', masters=['test'] ) mock_zone_create.assert_called_once_with(**args) # validate physical resource id self.assertEqual(mock_resource['id'], self.test_resource.resource_id) def test_resource_handle_update(self): mock_zone_update = self.test_client.zones.update self.test_resource.resource_id = '477e8273-60a7-4c41-b683-fdb0bc7cd151' prop_diff = {zone.DesignateZone.EMAIL: 'xyz@test-zone.com', zone.DesignateZone.DESCRIPTION: 'updated description', zone.DesignateZone.TTL: 4200, zone.DesignateZone.MASTERS: ['blah']} self.test_resource.handle_update(json_snippet=None, tmpl_diff=None, prop_diff=prop_diff) args = dict( id=self.test_resource.resource_id, description='updated description', ttl=4200, email='xyz@test-zone.com', masters=['blah'] ) mock_zone_update.assert_called_once_with(**args) def test_resolve_attributes(self): mock_zone = self._get_mock_resource() self.test_resource.resource_id = mock_zone['id'] self.test_client.zones.get.return_value = mock_zone self.assertEqual( mock_zone['serial'], self.test_resource._resolve_attribute(zone.DesignateZone.SERIAL)) self.test_client.zones.get.assert_called_once_with( self.test_resource.resource_id ) def test_resource_show_resource(self): args = dict( name='test', description='updated description', ttl=4200, email='xyz@test-zone.com' ) mock_zone_get = self.test_client.zones.get mock_zone_get.return_value = args self.assertEqual(args, self.test_resource._show_resource(), 'Failed to show resource')

commit_message:
Revise health policy example

Now, in one recover we only support one recover action.
If we use current health policy example to create policy, it will return
"Only one 'actions' is supported for now."
This patch revises health policy example to insure users can easily
create health policy successed by default example.

Change-Id: I5369157b85c2cc49f908a8570c633ee4b38184df

commit_message:
H402 hacking have been deprecated

H402 hacking have been removed since hacking 0.10.
https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/setup.cfg
test-requirements of python-tripleoclient require hacking<0.11,>=0.10.2.
So remove H402 ignore statement
Closes-Bug: #1653853

This commit adds support for using tags with a custom version scheme.

commit_message:
Add support for custom tag version schemes

This change adds the ability to specify regular expressions to define a
customised versioning scheme for release tags and pre-release tags.

By default this change supports the current versioning scheme used by
OpenStack.

To customise, update the config.yaml file with the appropriate values.
For example, for tags with versions like 'v1.0.0' and pre-release
versions like 'v1.0.0rc1' the following could be added to config.yaml:

release_tag_re: 'v\d\.\d\.\d(rc\d+)?'

subject: VM with Encrypted Vol throws error on hard reboot
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 11:24:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/48ca28a2018fa892fa2efdab4fe57ce2c2f49eaf', 'message': "VM with Encrypted Vol throws error on hard reboot

Analysis: While attaching volume to instance, Nova calls
connect_volume, this returns connection_info which
includes 'device_path' that shows the device path in computer host.
With encrypted volume, after the above steps,it needs to decrypt
the device.It creates a decrypted device with 'cryptsetup open',and
then make device_path in connection_info refer
to the new decrypted device.

When rebooting an instance, Nova instance is shut down without any
detaching operations. This seems incorrect, ideally it should detach
encryptor when powering off, and re-attach when starting.

Change-Id: I9427d67080c5cbab84bbcdc24f37673abb301df3
Closes-Bug: #1597234
Co-Authored-By: lisali <xiaoyan.li@intel.com>

commit_message:
VM with Encrypted Vol throws error on hard reboot

Analysis: While attaching volume to instance, Nova calls
connect_volume, this returns connection_info which
includes 'device_path' that shows the device path in computer host.
With encrypted volume, after the above steps,it needs to decrypt
the device.It creates a decrypted device with 'cryptsetup open',and
then make device_path in connection_info refer
to the new decrypted device.

When rebooting an instance, Nova instance is shut down without any
detaching operations. This seems incorrect, ideally it should detach
encryptor when powering off, and re-attach when starting.

Change-Id: I9427d67080c5cbab84bbcdc24f37673abb301df3
Closes-Bug: #1597234
Co-Authored-By: lisali <xiaoyan.li@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add unit tests for process failure flow

Change-Id: Iba6e33b4db7a76e9342f30d664486a5accf75866
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari refs/changes/42/396242/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 NTT DATA # All Rights Reserved. # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Unit Tests for process failure TaskFlow """ import mock from oslo_config import cfg from masakari.compute import nova from masakari import context from masakari.engine.drivers.taskflow import process_failure from masakari import exception from masakari import test from masakari.tests.unit import fakes CONF = cfg.CONF class ProcessFailureTestCase(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(ProcessFailureTestCase, self).setUp() self.ctxt = context.get_admin_context() # overriding 'wait_period_after_service_disabled' to 2 seconds to # reduce the wait period. CONF.set_override('wait_period_after_service_disabled', 2) @mock.patch('masakari.compute.nova.novaclient') def test_compute_process_failure_flow(self, _mock_novaclient): process_name = 'nova-compute' service_host = 'fake-host' _mock_novaclient.return_value = fakes.FakeNovaClient( host=service_host) novaclient = nova.API() # test DisableComputeNodeTask task = process_failure.DisableComputeNodeTask(novaclient) task.execute(self.ctxt, process_name, service_host) # test DisableComputeNodeTask task = process_failure.ConfirmComputeNodeDisabledTask(novaclient) task.execute(self.ctxt, process_name, service_host) # verify service is disabled self.assertTrue(novaclient.is_service_down(self.ctxt, service_host, process_name)) @mock.patch('masakari.compute.nova.novaclient') def test_compute_process_failure_flow_disbaled_process(self, _mock_novaclient): process_name = 'nova-compute' service_host = 'fake-host' _mock_novaclient.return_value = fakes.FakeNovaClient( host=service_host, service_status='disabled') novaclient = nova.API() # test DisableComputeNodeTask task = process_failure.DisableComputeNodeTask(novaclient) with mock.patch.object( novaclient, 'enable_disable_service') as mock_enable_disabled: task.execute(self.ctxt, process_name, service_host) # ensure that enable_disable_service never called self.assertEqual(0, mock_enable_disabled.call_count) @mock.patch('masakari.compute.nova.novaclient') def test_compute_process_failure_flow_disable_failed(self, _mock_novaclient): process_name = 'nova-compute' service_host = 'fake-host' _mock_novaclient.return_value = fakes.FakeNovaClient( host=service_host) novaclient = nova.API() # test DisableComputeNodeTask task = process_failure.DisableComputeNodeTask(novaclient) with mock.patch.object( novaclient, 'enable_disable_service'): task.execute(self.ctxt, process_name, service_host) # test DisableComputeNodeTask task = process_failure.ConfirmComputeNodeDisabledTask(novaclient) self.assertRaises(exception.ProcessRecoveryFailureException, task.execute, self.ctxt, process_name, service_host) def tearDown(self): CONF.clear_override('wait_period_after_service_disabled') super(ProcessFailureTestCase, self).tearDown()

subject: Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-04 00:53:50.000000000', 'files': ['tools/install_venv.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/d597dab65c75931a7c7e807c3290ba43683f6edd', 'message': "Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function.
When they are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the
Python interpreter. In this patch we have known main() got return
values(eg:0, 1), but it can't specifies exit status when terminate
the main thread by unusing sys.exit(). So when using sys.exit(main())
instead of main() may be more readable and reasonable.

Change-Id: Ie69b3a22dd1ddcd5586fc72f452cd162787f2f6f
"}]
commit_message:
Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function.
When they are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the
Python interpreter. In this patch we have known main() got return
values(eg:0, 1), but it can't specifies exit status when terminate
the main thread by unusing sys.exit(). So when using sys.exit(main())
instead of main() may be more readable and reasonable.

Change-Id: Ie69b3a22dd1ddcd5586fc72f452cd162787f2f6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/88/416388/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sys.exit(main(sys.argv))

commit_message:
Don't replace failed neutron resources always

Override needs_replace_failed() for all
neutron resource.

Change-Id: I1789540fe2caae18fb446cd069b827036dd86f1c
Blueprint: custom-update-replace-for-failed-resources

commit_message:
Check `resource_validate` before validate external

Check `resource_validate` first to make sure, we will not validate
external resources (which will required to provide actrual resource id to
check if existed) in template-validate.
Closes-Bug: #1654752

Change-Id: I01ee79b8a3cccb85dae23a96f56a66197187198a

commit_message:
pyroute2: Up the constraints for namespace improv

A new release of pyroute2 fixes inconsistencies and handling of network
namespaces. This will help with the Kuryr container-in-VM use cases.

Change-Id: I4b69ce0d1aed255a3bf86a5b43c48f62e517b34d

subject: Devstack failed for OVS DB connection modification
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-06 08:03:57.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/networking-ovn'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/bede7178cbbe5345b10771440811cd5163d4dc65', 'message': 'Devstack failed for OVS DB connection modification

Caused by this ovs commit:
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/84d0ca5d00fe01b29163236d48fa0f9105687149
To improve security, the NB and SB ovsdb daemons no longer
have open ptcp connections by default.  This is a change in
behavior from previous versions, users wishing to use TCP
connections to the NB/SB daemons can either request that
a passive TCP connection be used via ovn-ctl command-line
options (e.g. via OVN_CTL_OPTS/OVN_NORTHD_OPTS in startup
scripts):
    --db-sb-create-insecure-remote=yes
    --db-nb-create-insecure-remote=yes

Thus add option to devstack:
    --db-nb-create-insecure-remote=$DB_NB_INSECURE_REMOTE
    --db-sb-create-insecure-remote=$DB_SB_INSECURE_REMOTE

Change-Id: Ic57b971c8f35235fcaf3a5200de3f18e5166cdc1
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Devstack failed for OVS DB connection modification

Caused by this ovs commit:
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/84d0ca5d00fe01b29163236d48fa0f9105687149
To improve security, the NB and SB ovsdb daemons no longer
have open ptcp connections by default.  This is a change in
behavior from previous versions, users wishing to use TCP
connections to the NB/SB daemons can either request that
a passive TCP connection be used via ovn-ctl command-line
options (e.g. via OVN_CTL_OPTS/OVN_NORTHD_OPTS in startup
scripts):
    --db-sb-create-insecure-remote=yes
    --db-nb-create-insecure-remote=yes

Thus add option to devstack:
    --db-nb-create-insecure-remote=$DB_NB_INSECURE_REMOTE
    --db-sb-create-insecure-remote=$DB_SB_INSECURE_REMOTE

Change-Id: Ic57b971c8f35235fcaf3a5200de3f18e5166cdc1
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/09/417309/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Role based resource access control - get workflows

We already supported role based api access control, this series patches
will implement resource access control for mistral, so that
administrator could define the rules of resource accessibility, e.g.
admin user could get/delete/update the workflows of other tenants
according to the policy.

TODO:
- Implement update workflow by admin
- Implement delete workflow by admin
- Implement for other resources(workfbook/execution/task/action, etc.)

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-rbac

Change-Id: I8b00e8a260a74457ad037ee7322a7cba9ae34fab

commit_message:
Do nothing in prepare_for_replace if server not created

If the server is not created no need to do anything
before replace it.

commit_message:
Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher

oslo.messaging allow dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods since
5.11.0 in d3a8f280ebd6fd12865fd20c4d772774e39aefa2, set with
DefaultRPCAccessPolicy to fix FutureWarning like:

"The access_policy argument is changing its default value to <class
'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'> in version '?',
please update the code to explicitly set None as the value:
access_policy defaults to LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which exposes private
methods. Explicitly set access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy or
ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy.

Change-Id: I169d187c757dc97f447dad9a441a3d8d7e91b046
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/42/413442/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_messaging.rpc import dispatcher access_policy = dispatcher.DefaultRPCAccessPolicy serializer=serializer, access_policy=access_policy)

commit_message:
Enable etcd DB backend testing pipeline

As disussed in project plan, we decided to adopt etcd to store
container data which is faster and more flexible than mysql.

This commit enable etcd DB backend testing pipeline in Zun
and adjust the code correspondingly:

1. Set the value of 'db_type' to 'etcd' when runing etcd
   pipeline: 'gate-zun-devstack-dsvm-docker-etcd-nv'.
2. Drop the 'get_XXX_by_id' methods from etcd API since 'id'
   attribute makes no sense in etcd data model.
3. Adjust DB related test cases.
4. Make etcd write request thead-safe.

After the etcd related code been well tested, we'll change the
default DB type from 'mysql' to 'etcd'.

Part of blueprint etcd-db-driver

Change-Id: I06ac9b719ce93898cd4f67f1c7bdc2e0803e086e

commit_message:
Commands displays operated stacks instead of all the stacks

Added two methods _display_stack_lists and _display_single_list_stack.
_display_stack_lists has been made specifically for stack-delete, if a
user wants to delete more than one stacks then it can be costly to make
a API call for every deleted stacks. All the lists are collected and
then relevant stacks are displayed.

_display_single_list_stack is used to display to the stack, a get call
is made for a specific stack and stack is displayed.

Change-Id: Iba00bfbae9747fe591acc191e05e204fa1d9c9bb

commit_message:
Remove unused init_only kwarg from wsgi app init

Since d8673cb256e17fec05788907fce66898a36ddcf2 the init_only
kwarg is no longer used in the compute API wsgi app setup.
This patch removes it along with it's usage throughout the
compute REST API unit tests where it was used to isolate
testing of extensions, which is not valid anymore as all
extensions are enabled and we removed the ability to
whitelist/blacklist them.

Change-Id: I2f58b7944d0f7d7c05683238474954a65a617ec3

commit_message:
Delete RoleAssignment if user/group does not exist

Currently deleting a user/group directly results
in stack containing RoleAssignment resource stuck
in DELETE_FAILED, when deleting the stack.This patch
fixes it.

Related-Bug: #1614400
(cherry picked from commit 1bb21c5bb3e1612cf4478465c1aa5a022b45f983)

Change-Id: Ib62d1898ed105f599a8d852885f69bc45bd420b4

commit_message:
Instal jq before deploy.sh in OVB jobs

This will be used by the TLS everywhere job on the CA setup part (which
runs before the undercloud install), and is also used by the undercloud
anyway, so we install this from the start.

Change-Id: I471dc7d872fda11dc4e48ec23d412ab0256c666d

commit_message:
Don't trace on ImageNotFound in delete_image_on_error

The point of the delete_image_on_error decorator is to
cleanup an image used during snapshot operations, so it
makes little sense to log an exception trace if the image
delete fails because the image no longer exists, which it
might not since _snapshot_instance method will proactively
delete non-active images in certain situations.

So let's just handle the ImageNotFound and ignore it.

Change-Id: I14e061a28678ad28e38bd185e3d0a35cae41a9cf
Closes-Bug: #1648574
(cherry picked from commit 2bb70e7b15e6cfef4652e2e49c4e02d151d2dbdf)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/26/408826/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except exception.ImageNotFound: # Since we're trying to cleanup an image, we don't care if # if it's already gone. pass

Add structure for Devstack plugin

This review creates the structure for the Devstack plugin and
prints to the console to ensure its execution in the gate.

Follow-up reviews will do more useful stuff like setting up
the environment for our functional testing (ldap, federation).

Depends-On: Ia8d07b4295ca165be01e44466c95d5275f596e83

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-23 06:42:29.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone', 'stackrc'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/468140a8c98ce76118d9ff6802fc5a1599697ad4', 'message': "Add new parameter RECREATE_KEYSTONE_DB

Devstack recreates Keystone DB each time during Keystone service installation.

commit_message:
Add new parameter RECREATE_KEYSTONE_DB

If 'RECREATE_KEYSTONE_DB=False' database won't be recreated.
It would be useful for multinode Grenade tests for Keystone. This parameter
will help us to deploy multiple services on different machines talking to
the same DB.

Devstack recreates Keystone DB each time during Keystone service installation.
If our controller node is already deployed, Keystone DB already contains
important information about OpenStack services and their endpoints. When
the second Keystone node is being deployed, we don't want to delete
records about controllers' services endpoints.

Partially-Implements: bp rolling-upgrade-testing

Change-Id: Ia8d07b4295ca165be01e44466c95d5275f596e83
(cherry picked from commit ea3e87d4e5a7a23870e86bbe133064a99e9519cf)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/38/414438/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We may not need to recreate database in case 2 Keystone services # sharing the same database. It would be useful for multinode Grenade tests. RECREATE_KEYSTONE_DB=$(trueorfalse True RECREATE_KEYSTONE_DB)

commit_message:
update aclmanager to use default series argument

Instead of requiring the series argument, look at the default that the
rest of the scripts use. There is still a command line option for
overriding the default.

Change-Id: I7168b4786ac8f275da1ff0cd177268b3a4c20c17
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Revert bumping upper constrains for openstacksdk

This commit partially reverts 9479b72

OpenstackSDK 0.9.12 doesn't fix all issues which occured by 0.9.11 which was
blocked previously - Ieb500043bcd18f887ee11b1fdbe1a61dab3459b5.

At least Rally gates are broken due to unability to setup neutron quotas via
openstackclient.

Change-Id: Ib9a3ece63d1e6bd91758862f3fc542743435b3f3
Related-Bug: #1652317

commit_message:
Prevent MemoryError when logging response bodies

Response bodies are loaded into memory prior to
being logged.

Loading huge response bodies may result in a
MemoryError.

This patch proposes that only JSON and TEXT
responses be logged, i.e when the Content-Type
header is application/json or application/text.

Responses that do not include or have a different
Content-Type header will have their body omitted.

This is a sort of backport of the fix for
keystoneauth sessions, see
I93b6fff73368c4f58bdebf8566c4948b50980cee

Co-Authored-By: Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz <samueldmq@gmail.com>

Closes-bug: 1616105

Change-Id: I8f43eee3a0b35041c6cf672e476f8151cf2f8d14
(cherry picked from commit 3e56e0d7e5e1a76d806a3bc1f6d5ef9070f95771)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/93/418093/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _LOG_CONTENT_TYPES = set(['application/json', 'application/text']) # NOTE(samueldmq): If the response does not provide enough info about # the content type to decide whether it is useful and safe to log it # or not, just do not log the body. Trying to# read the response body # anyways may result on reading a long stream of bytes and getting an # unexpected MemoryError. See bug 1616105 for further details. content_type = response.headers.get('content-type', None) if content_type in _LOG_CONTENT_TYPES: text = _remove_service_catalog(response.text) else: text = ('Omitted, Content-Type is set to %s. Only ' 'application/json and application/text responses ' 'have their bodies logged.') % content_type string_parts.append('\nRESP BODY: %s\n' % strutils.mask_password(text))
deleted_lines: text = _remove_service_catalog(response.text) if text: string_parts.append('\nRESP BODY: %s\n' % strutils.mask_password(text))

Response bodies are loaded into memory prior to
being logged.

Loading huge response bodies may result in a

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/91/418091/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - > [`bug 1616105 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystoneauth/+bug/1616105>`_] Only log the response body when the ``Content-Type`` header is set to ``application/json`` or ``application/text``. This avoids logging large binary objects (such as images). Other ``Content-Type`` will not be logged.

commit_message:
Calls to federated service providers using Keystone-to-Keystone

Allow users to direct calls using the OpenStackClient to a remote
federated service provider using Keystone 2 Keystone federation.

Change-Id: Icbdb286f840ecd3a57c64ef69b9e55925439b2f1

Auto measurements

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-specs refs/changes/71/223971/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================= Auto measurements ================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/autodoc-meter-list Problem description =================== Currently, when developers want to add new measurement, they need also to update the measurements document[1]. the measurements doc is easy out of date, because not all of developers have a good habit updating. Adding a mechanism to auto-generating the measurements list will be very convenient. Proposed change =============== Firstly, we should consider what fields we want to show in measurements list. reference the documentation [1], this proposal want to collect following fields in every measurement item:: +------+------+------+--------+---------+-------------+ | name | type | unit | origin | support | description | +------+------+------+--------+---------+-------------+ Note, the *resource* fields is hard to be directly collected from declarative metrics, and I'm not sure if it is needed, so exclude it now. This blueprint propose to implement script(s) that can be integrated as a Sphinx plugin, which will generate measurements when build docs. by Regarding to the sources of metrics, there are 3 ways to collect metrics we should consider: 1. Metrics from polling pollsters. Firstly, we need to add doc string to every pollster, the doc string include description, name, type, unit. this change will also make the pollster implementation more readable. Secondly, a script will be implemented to load all pollster extentions, then get the doc string and parse it to a measurement item. for an example:: class IncomingBytesPollster(_Base): """Number of incoming bytes of an instance. name: network.incoming.bytes type: Cumulative unit: B """ def _get_sample(self, instance, vnic, info): return self.make_vnic_sample( instance, name='network.incoming.bytes', type=sample.TYPE_CUMULATIVE, unit='B', volume=info.rx_bytes, vnic_data=vnic, ) 2. Metrics from declarative definitions. We can just load the yaml config file to collect the name, type, unit from every meter config. But the description of every meter didn't include in the config, it need to add "description" field for this functionality. 3. For metrics from transformer, this set of meters is in a small amount, and we cannot get the related info. This blueprint propose to add a yaml file to include these measurements and need to be updated manually if new meter from transformer added. Alternatives ------------ To minimise the change on current implementation, we don't need to add the name, type, unit to doc string of every pollster (but the description is still needed), we can just extract these 3 fields from the pollster code. There is simple demo to show you this solution, see[2]. But this can be broken if the pollsters implementation is very different with current ones. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None beyond existing concerns. Pipeline impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: liusheng Other contributors: None Ongoing maintainer: liusheng Work Items ---------- * Update the doc string of every pollster to adapt this proposal. * Update the declarative meters definition adding "description" field. * Add yaml file to contain meter definitions from transformer. * Implement scripts to generate measurements list and generate rst format measurements. Future lifecycle ================ None Dependencies ============ No new dependencies. Testing ======= This functionality can be tested with Sphinx doc building. Documentation Impact ==================== This spec propose to add a Sphinx plugin to generate measurements in-tree. References ========== [1] http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/telemetry-measurements.html [2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/447421/

commit_message:
Remove in-tree q-lbaas support

Neutron-lbaas has devstack plugin, which is expected to handle it.

Closes-Bug: #1551282
Change-Id: I19355b9edc732fcb360010bc5e06639f1a1ed3bc

deleted_lines: NEUTRON_LBAAS_DIR=$DEST/neutron-lbaas# Default provider for load balancer service DEFAULT_LB_PROVIDER=LOADBALANCER:Haproxy:neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.drivers.haproxy.plugin_driver.HaproxyOnHostPluginDriver:default if is_service_enabled q-lbaas; then deprecated "Configuring q-lbaas through devstack is deprecated" _configure_neutron_lbaas fi if is_service_enabled q-lbaas; then git_clone $NEUTRON_LBAAS_REPO $NEUTRON_LBAAS_DIR $NEUTRON_LBAAS_BRANCH setup_develop $NEUTRON_LBAAS_DIR fi if is_service_enabled q-lbaas; then neutron_agent_lbaas_install_agent_packages fi run_process q-lbaas "$AGENT_LBAAS_BINARY --config-file $NEUTRON_CONF --config-file $LBAAS_AGENT_CONF_FILENAME" if is_service_enabled q-lbaas; then neutron_lbaas_stop fifunction _configure_neutron_lbaas { # Uses oslo config generator to generate LBaaS sample configuration files (cd $NEUTRON_LBAAS_DIR && exec ./tools/generate_config_file_samples.sh) if [ -f $NEUTRON_LBAAS_DIR/etc/neutron_lbaas.conf.sample ]; then cp $NEUTRON_LBAAS_DIR/etc/neutron_lbaas.conf.sample $NEUTRON_CONF_DIR/neutron_lbaas.conf iniset $NEUTRON_CONF_DIR/neutron_lbaas.conf service_providers service_provider $DEFAULT_LB_PROVIDER neutron_server_config_add $NEUTRON_CONF_DIR/neutron_lbaas.conf fi neutron_agent_lbaas_configure_common neutron_agent_lbaas_configure_agent }
